intro: Grevillea montis-cole subsp. montis-cole, commonly known as the Mount Cole grevillea, is a shrub native to the alpine regions of southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and vibrant red or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Proteaceae family, which includes many species with showy inflorescences. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
